name: How to make Almond Milk at home
description: How to make Almond Milk at home with raw or blanched almonds. Easy, delicious and less cleaning if you use blanched almonds.

recipeInstructions.text: Soak the almonds in enough water overnight. I keep them on the counter for a few hours and then refrigerate.
recipeInstructions.name: Soak the almonds in enough water overnight. I keep them on the counter for a few hours and then refrigerate.

recipeInstructions.text: Drain and wash the almonds. Add boiling water to the bowl and let sit for 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Drain and wash the almonds. Add boiling water to the bowl and let sit for 5 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Drain, wash, add the almonds to the blender. Add 1 cup water.
recipeInstructions.name: Drain, wash, add the almonds to the blender. Add 1 cup water.

recipeInstructions.text: Blend for a few minutes for 2-3 cycles. Add 1/2 to 1 cup more water + salt + sweetener. Blend blend. I usually add 1/2 cup to make a creamy almond milk to use in chai or coffee. Add more water to preferred consistency.
recipeInstructions.name: Blend for a few minutes for 2-3 cycles. Add 1/2 to 1 cup more water + salt + sweetener. Blend blend. I usually add 1/2 cup to make a creamy almond milk to use in chai or coffee. Add more water to preferred consistency.

recipeInstructions.text: If using blanched almonds, you can strain the almond milk through a strainer or cheesecloth lined sieve or nut milk bag. Use a spoon to press when the strainer is full, remove pulp from the strainer and strain the remaining milk.
recipeInstructions.name: If using blanched almonds, you can strain the almond milk through a strainer or cheesecloth lined sieve or nut milk bag. Use a spoon to press when the strainer is full, remove pulp from the strainer and strain the remaining milk.

recipeInstructions.text: If using unpeeled almonds, strain through a nut milk bag or cheesecloth lined sieve. Squeeze to remove as much milk as possible.
recipeInstructions.name: If using unpeeled almonds, strain through a nut milk bag or cheesecloth lined sieve. Squeeze to remove as much milk as possible.

recipeInstructions.text: Use the pulp to add creaminess to any of the Indian curries, soups or Dals. Or make almond pulp cookies,
recipeInstructions.name: Use the pulp to add creaminess to any of the Indian curries, soups or Dals. Or make almond pulp cookies,

recipeInstructions.text: Store in the refrigerator for 4 to 5 days. If you don't use up the milk within 4 or 5 days, freeze into ice cubes to use to add to smoothies, curries etc, or make almond milk yogurt from my cookbook.
